In China, marriage is a legally recognized union between two people, and it is governed by the Marriage Law of the People's Republic of China. The law sets out the rights and obligations of husband and wife, as well as the procedures for divorce.

According to the law, both husband and wife have equal rights and responsibilities in marriage. They must support each other and share the costs of living expenses, medical care, and education. They must also care for and protect their children.

In the event of a divorce, the court will consider various factors, such as the length of the marriage, the income and property of both parties, and the needs of their children. The court may divide the joint property of the couple and grant alimony to one party.

It is important for individuals to understand their rights and obligations under the law and to seek legal advice if necessary.
